headline: Delicious Black Bean Burritos
description: These black bean burritos with onion, bell pepper, garlic, and jalapeño are deliciously rich and creamy thanks to the addition of cream cheese.

video.description: Black beans, cream cheese, & green chiles give basic burrito’s a tasty makeover.
video.name: Delicious Black Bean Burritos

name: Delicious Black Bean Burritos
recipeIngredient: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Wrap tortillas in foil.
Bake wrapped tortillas in the preheated oven until heated through, about 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and jalapeño; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in beans and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. Stir in cream cheese and salt; cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Stir in cilantro.

Spoon filling in a line across the middle of each tortilla. Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling. Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling creating a burrito. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: I forego the jalapeños and cilantro and add a can of Rotel (drained) with 1/2 tsp chili powder and 1/2 tsp cumin. It’s perfect and so easy to make. We love this!
I never thought a first time made BBB recipe would turn out so good! My friends loved it and I was so so happy with it. Just as a comment, I added some extra spices to give it more "zing".

Amazing burritos. I replace the cilantro with parsley and a little lemon juice because cilantro tastes like soap to me. I also give the burritos a nice sear on either side after wrapping them, it really adds something. I've been making these for years.
I added chicken seasoned with all recipes taco seasoning.
We lightly coat the burritos with oil and kosher salt, then bake for 20 minutes at 400F. This creates a crispy coating and hot, hot, hot fillings. Cut them open and sprinkle with cheese and voila!
I followed others and added some cumin, and topped my burrito with salsa, more cheese and sour cream. With a salad and some fruit, this was a delicious vegetarian dinner that will be on our rotation.
It's a hit with the family. It's easy and nutritious. I add cumin and more garlic to the recipe. If I have lime juice, a splash of that goes in, too.
Awesome have to try it
Easy and tasty. Very satisfying vegetarian meal.
I enjoyed was easy and quick to make the only thing different I would do is not use cream cheese
So easy to make and taste great! Will definitely make again, thx-
I made it as part of a 30 minute meal, with Linnie’s Spanish rice and cilantro, avocado, tomato salad. Was awesome. i cheated and added ground turkey to the burritos. Wicked when added as a meal....
These are soooo delicious. Definitely add some cumin and salsa to the filling. I doubled the recipe and made 8 small burritos, wrapped in foil and put in the freezer for quick, easy meals!
Easy, quick and good!
I’ve been making these for over 10 years and my family and I still love them!
Another winner for us! So easy and delicious. The perfect blend of ingredients for the ultimate burrito.

These were delicious!! I used brown rice tortilla wraps from Trader Joes which are gluten free and made the mistake if only adding 2 ounces of cream cheese instead of 3 and it still turned out great. Can't wait to try them again.
Absolutely delicious. I will be making this dinner quite often!
This was a good healthy meal for my mom and I. My mom was skeptical because it didn't have any meat. But she enjoyed.
It has a great blend of flavors and tastes very good. I used parsley instead of cilantro, for some family members, including me, do not like it. It will definitely be made again
I made 6/2/2020. It was good; kind of dry/thick w/the cream cheese. I may just do shredded low fat cheese next time. I like the red bell pepper in it.

This is a very good recipe! Using cream cheese makes it so good. However, it was a tad dry to me. The next time I make this I am going to take the advice of some reviewers and add Ro Tel or diced tomatoes with green chilis. Also, I'll heat the tortillas in the microwave to get them soft instead of heating them in the oven. It's just easier for me that way. Thanks for an outstanding recipe!

I really thought these were delicious. I added fresh corn cut from the cob to the vegetable mix, and that was a great addition. My son was not a fan of the cream cheese and suggested I could leave it out completely. When I said that they may be too dry, he said he would add a salsa or guacamole of his choice. Hey, it's worth trying, right? I doubled the recipe and had a ton left, which I rolled into tortillas and froze for future lunches.
Delicious and easy recipe.
Added chicken and more peppers but really good.
It was just okay. My husband really didn't like it and I didn't like it enough to make it again.
Amazing!! Instead of fresh jalapeños I used from a jar drained and used a small bottle of cilantro hot sauce. . Great recipe for using black beans!!!
Will definitely make it again.
Will definitely make it again.
So easy and delicious! It quickly made its way into being a staple meal!
We loved this!!! Easy and really great taste
Adding this to my Family Favorites! I made the beans in my Instant Pot, then did the rest of the recipe as stated. Yummy, fast and easy!
I did not make any changes . And I will make it again and again for my no meat day!!
You can also use leftover hamburger. This is awesome...the creamcheese makes it so creamy!
This was so easy and yummy!!! Added a bit of cumin and some shredded chicken for protein!!

Very tasty! I did not have jalapenos so I added a 7oz can green chilies, a little cumin and a sprinkle of chili powder. I also cooked and shredded a large chicken breast and put it into the mixture. Delicious. Next time I will add all the extra stuff and the jalapeno. I like a little kick. Thanks for a great dinner!
good taste and easy to make. needs some extra spice and a little heat.
Made for a quick and easy lunch. Did have jalapeños nor bell peppers, added some cumin and chili powder for a bit of a punch. Thanks for sharing your recipe.

I used Daiya based cream cheese, and I didn’t have any jalepeños so I used some Heredez green avocado salsa, and at the last minute I tossed in about a cup of fire roasted corn. Everything else as per the original recipe. It was delicious!
This recipe is easy to make and delicious! I added some salsa to my tortilla, along with the chopped cilantro. Will definitely be making this again!
Delicious! I will definitely make this again!
Left out the cilantro because I didn't have any and I'm avoiding the grocery store due to corona virus. They were awesome! My wife loved them and asked me to put them in regular rotation.
Just didn’t hit the mark. Family didn’t care fir it either. Not quite sure what it was about it.
fast easy taste pretty good

This was a very delicious meat free dinner! I mixed shredded cheddar cheese with cream cheese and used the suggestion of adding cumin. Exchanged the jalapeno's with mild green chili's. This would be excellent as a dip with tortilla chips also.

I doubled the recipe
added 2 t of cumin 
And 2 t coriander 
As a substitute for cream cheese I microwaved a sweet potato. Peeled it. And mashed it into to the pot w my potato masher. It was delicious!
The family all loved it!!
I added rotisserie chicken as well. Hubby loved it..

I made these for dinner last Friday. They were very good even though I had to use hard corn tacos (can't find what you want during this corona virus). The only thing I added was a squirt of lime juice that brought them to a 5 star recipe.

I had to make changes after I started to make this, which I would only give 3 stars if I followed the recipe because it just needed "something". I did not have plain cream cheese so I added some garden vegetable cream cheese that was in the refrigerator and I couldn't tell the difference.
 I also added half a can of refried beans and I put in about a cup of brown rice and almost a 10 oz can of tomatoes with green chilies since it really needed some tomato in it. I threw in a bunch of chopped fresh spinach too and I used 3 large cloves of garlic and also added some spice (cumin and garlic powder).
Amazing! And so, so easy to make! I did not have fresh cilantro, so I used dried. Adding a little sour cream made it a little less dry, too! Served with rice and salsa, yum!

Yes, I used small white tortillas. Much less sodium
I do like the recipt
Lovely, easy recipe! Love the cream cheese in this. I did put salsa on top for my husband, because he found it a bit dry. Served with sweet potato fries.

IT was awesome. I just used onion, lots of garlic, cream cheese and plenty of sweet ‘n hot jalapeños with the black beans. Omitted the bell pepper and cilantro. Used olive oil instead of vegetable oil.

Since grocery store trips are few during the pandemic l was attracted by this recipe because l had everything but the jalapeno. I had to substitute street taco shells but that was merely a logistical issue. A few red pepper flakes replaced the jalapeno. My wife loved it and it will be a repeat in our menu schedule.

This tasted very good. It can also be adapted to what you have on hand, for example, substituting refried beans for black beans. You can dial the heat up or down to suit your taste. I skipped the jalapeño. I’ll be adding this to my favorites.
Sooo yummy! Sooo easy!
Delicious and quick. Switched out cream cheese for regular cheddar.

I added a little sour cream and salsa. I also warmed the tortillas in the microwave. 
I really liked it and definitely will be making it again. 
Very easy and fast
I liked it although it was a bit odd that the black beans had no seasoning on them. My 7yo liked them though so it's not a total loss I guess.
it is soooo good
I also added corn, diced tomatoes, cumin and chili powder. It is so good this way. Will definitely make it again.
My family really enjoyed these burritos. I will be making them again. The leftovers even tasted good for breakfast with an egg.
Popular at home and work carry ins. Also delicious with cubed roasted chicken mixed in
added some spices to it but loved the black bean-cream cheese combo! will become a regular breakfast at ours.
I enjoyed it. Kids did not.
cheap easy and delicious. I added green chilis as the video suggested and put in a tad less cream cheese and salt. Topped with some mexican style shredded cheese and an avocado. Will make again!
Great Recipe!
Very Good! I added the cumin and chili powder as the other review suggested. Its fabulous.

I will make this again, with a couple changes. 
Though we followed the recipe our first try was, well, gummy. Very thick from all the cream cheese. Next time we'll use less cream cheese and the light variety. 
To thin it out a bit, we did add salsa, and it added a nice tomato flavor, a bit more heat and cut the heavy cheesiness.
Amazing turned out great
This recipe was awesome! This goes on the menu. I would like to play with it and fund vegan alternative for the sour cream.

I loved this. I did make changes. 
I added:
1 can tomatoes with green chiles, 1 small can diced green chiles, 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp chili powder, 1/4 tsp oregano, 1/4 tsp smoked paprika, and salt to taste. 

I cut the cream cheese to 2 oz and honestly, it was still more than I wanted (I don't need all those fat grams!). I'll cut back to 1 oz next time - it goes further than I thought when melted.

 This will definitely go into my rotation. YUM!

I doubled this recipe and also included a can of diced tomatoes per some other reviews. This was good, but not great. Can't beat the price though! I will probably make it again, but maybe just get creative with some toppings/sides.
Great dish!
I cooked this exactly according to the recipe for three adults. None of us cared for it. We didn't enjoy the cream cheese in the burritos.
No cream cheese, add more spice

These are wonderful. My family loved the pepper, onion, and bean filling. I didn't have any cream cheese so I used sour cream and it worked just as well, the sourness counteracted the spice (I ignored the recommended spices and kind of just added whatever I wanted from my spice rack). I will definitely be making these again ??
This has become a favorite meal, especially with a drizzle of lime on each bite---Wow! Delicious with the cumin as well!
I have been trying to find more vegetarian recipes that my family will eat. I made this using some of the substitutes recommended.

We really liked this and will make again but with some modifications. We're not cilantro fans so we left that out, otherwise we followed the directions. It seemed dry, so we poured on some leftover cheese dip and salsa when we put these together. I will make these again but will take some other reviewers suggestions and add some cumin and a can of rotel tomatoes. All in all, it's a keeper for meatless Mondays!
Delicious! I had so much filling I stuffed 4 instead of 2.
I wonder how the calories would change by taking out the wrap? I make a huge batch of just the filling and keep it around to eat by itself!
So tasty! I like making this for easy lunches now, although I like to add seasonings to mine like cumin, chili, etc. very very delicious.
Really tasty burritos! Added diced tomatoes, corn, and chilli powder and cayenne pepper as well! AMAZING!!

Delicious! My husband and I loved it. I made it exactly as posted. This will be our go-to recipe on a regular basis for years to come; thank you so much for sharing! It is a very simple recipe to make, and FULL of flavour! We added rice for the kids because their little taste buds couldn’t handle it. This significantly reduced the flavour for them. Perfect for a family of 4 with some leftovers!

I made this with a can of chicken breast, Rio Tel Diced Tomatoes and Green Chilis, as well as Bush's Black Bean Fiesta. In addition, my family likes a lot of garlic powder. I love herbs/spices so I added Italian Seasoning, Dill Weed, Cilantro, Chives, and Tumeric. I have a bottle mixture of Smoked Paprika with garlic, chilis, and something else (can't remember it right now). So all this had the nice spicy but not burn down your throat spicy. I also already had Walmart's brand of organic salsa which I just poured out of the bottle and fiesta five cheese and of course the black olives. This will be a good meal for my elderly mother and I for now on. It's also very easy to make and time saving when I get off work after working a 10 hour shift. I had left over which I took for my lunch the next day. Two co-workers really liked it and I told them about the recipe. I sent pictures and texted the recipe to my sister who plans on making this as well.

I made this with a can of chicken breast, Rio Tel Diced Tomatoes and Green Chilis, as well as Bush's Black Bean Fiesta. In addition, my family likes a lot of garlic powder. I love herbs/spices so I added Italian Seasoning, Dill Weed, Cilantro, Chives, and Tumeric. I have a bottle mixture of Smoked Paprika with garlic, chilis, and something else (can't remember it right now). So all this had the nice spicy but not burn down your throat spicy. I also already had Walmart's brand of organic salsa which I just poured out of the bottle and fiesta five cheese and of course the black olives. This will be a good meal for my elderly mother and I for now on. It's also very easy to make and time saving when I get off work after working a 10 hour shift. I had left over which I took for my lunch the next day. Two co-workers really liked it and I told them about the recipe. I sent pictures and texted the recipe to my sister who plans on making this as well.

This recipe has become a regular in our house. I don't follow the recipe exactly, using it as more of an outline, but it always turns out great. I usually add roasted tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, corn & cheese (when assembling or melt on top) to the recipe, and swap out the jalapeño peppers with green chili peppers because 2 of my kids don't like spicy food. For those of us who like things a bit more spicey, we add salsa.
I will be making these again. My husband loved them and said they were restaurant-quality. I didn't use cilantro and added Chile Arbol to make them spicy. Don't use too much Chile arbol.
Yummy is what i have to say
Love this recipe! I make it without the jalapeños and the tortillas for myself and my 2 year old all the time for lunch. We just put it in a bowl and eat it with a spoon.

As written I give this recipe a 4, but with the addition of some of the reviewers suggestions I give it a 5. My husband and my two children loved it. I made as written with the addition of half a can of chopped tomatoes with green chilies including some of the juices.
This is a good starting point, however it is severely lacking in flavor. I tried it with 2 full minced jalapenos and added in some taco seasoning which really made a difference.

The addition of cream cheese was a nice touch I had not thought of before. Per some other reviews, I added a can of (generic) Rotel, shredded carrots, and some frozen corn. This recipe made 4-5 burritos (enough for 4 people). I also only used about 2 oz of cream cheese. It added a really nice creamy touch and we did not need to use sour cream with the burritos. I served it with Spanish Brown Rice from this website. Very good and will make it again.
I thought it was good but I left out the bell pepper and the jalapeños since my boys were eating it too.
I don't really understand all the rave reviews. This recipe was completely bland, no flavor! Thank goodness for salsa!
I added mushrooms, frozencorn, and canned diced tomatos. Was great. My husband was a fan.
Delicious as is. So simple to make too!!!

These are very good - especially if you want to forgo meat for a meal. I doubled the black beans, red bell pepper, used partially yellow onion & partially green onions as I didnt have any jalapenos. I also used 1 can green chilies ( enough heat) about 1-1/2 tsp cumin, and about the same in salt - should've cut back the salt a little more. Used 2 cloves garlic and each serving we lined with Mexican shredded cheeese & salsa before rolling. Everyone liked them. We used the soft taco size and each ate 2 - (4 of us)!! Served with homemade coleslaw - it was a good meal - definitely fix again.
